Hello, people and @wakeupsingapore this may not be a popular opinion so I'm posting this comment using my spam account. But anw I just wanna give my thoughts on the subject and the administrator's comments. Firstly, I don't feel that what the dorm operators did was necessarily wrong. Their objective is to curb the spread, and much like how people who return from overseas have to serve SHN (legal confinement), the dorm operators confined the workers in order to limit their movements and stop the spread. However, I feel that their approach towards it is wrong. Since they do not have the rights to confine the workers, they should've contacted the authorities in order to list them down as contactees for contact tracing / quarantine the workers legally? (idk how that works). FURTHERMORE, I feel that it is inaccurate to say that all they got is a "stern warning" as police investigations are on going... Would you rather the dorm operators be wrongfully punished?... So yes, for now they've only received a stern warning. However, that may change as the police concludes their investigations. MOREOVER, the dorm operators confined the workers for 1 day. Before shifting them into a warehouse w toilet access. And I'm assuming this warehouse where they're held at is legal as MOM and CNA didn't report anything illegal about that, maybe it wasn't locked from the outside or something. So, maybe them keeping the workers in that room is probably just to hold them, until they prepped the warehouse or something. I really don't know. HOWEVER, I just wna say that although what many of the dorm operators have done are wrong and much of this wrongdoings have come to light recently, I feel that it is also unjust for you to make those kinds of statements against them and MOM. Well, anyways I urge my fellow Singaporeans to read the articles and not just the titles before jumping into conclusions. Thanks for reading if u read this far.

And yes, my opinion is that it is too fast to jump to conclusions and for those that have only read the administrators comments, isnt it skewing their perception, as they do not know any better? Or maybe cuz the 'victim killed the owners mum and ate his dog' and when the owner came back he injured her and locked her in the basement? Right... investigation in ongoing... And yeaa u didn't have to copy n paste it lol... N again yahh, personal atk.. Still don't understand what you're trying to do here... You are talking to an anonymous down syndrome giraffe for god sake... Idgaf... You don't know me and I'd rather not know someone like you...

@downy_giraffie okay, let me break it down even simpler. i said "actions does not equate intentions". that does not mean intentions justify actions? on contrary, it means the opposite. first you say you "don't feel what the dorm operators did was necessarily wrong", then you say "their intentions MAY be right". this is truly a big brain moment. the definition of "did" is the past of "do", and "do" means actions. therefore, did you not just argue that what they DID (ACTION OF LOCKING THEM IN) may not be wrong? also, consider the hypocrisy here. you're protecting an opinion by attacking somebody else's opinion with your own. ????? "skewing public perception"???? LOL. if you are so easily influenced by other people's opinions then you technically don't have your own. aren't you trying to influence somebody else's opinion as well? you're right, emotions should not interfere with logic. but as decent humans should we not have empathy? if a victim was found raped and locked in the basement, would your first instinct be to go to high court and say "no eviDenCe cAnnOt conDemn kidNapPer"? furthermore, you have not answered to the following part of my argument. did you not read the excerpt? i even copied and pasted for you man. 😩 but ok. ig i'm such an insolent brat. hence, to conclude my statement, i would like to quote the famous wise philosopher, Nicki Minaj. "eat a Barbie ass or sumthin."

@prophetsheryl Hi, so yea. Your points are well thought. But you've missed the point of my argument. My stand is that I felt that the actions taken were wrong, but the dorm ops may not be entirely wrong, because the police are still investigating into the matter. So, without perfect information about the entire situation, I am unable to conclude if they are right / wrong and the extent of which it is so. 
The administrators point of view was that MOM was too lenient on the dorm ops and the dorm ops were wrong. Which I felt was unjust because the information was inaccurate. A 'stern warning' isn't what all they've got. It is all they've gotten 'for now'. Like I said, still under investigation. What would you want MOM to do, when they havnt got the full picture? He / she has drawn a conclusion based on inaccurate information and is skewing public perception. Which I felt was unjust. 
My point on justifying the dorm ops actions was to clarify the situation as well as give a different perspective on what MAY have happened. Whether you believe it's right or wrong, it's your opinions and I rly couldn't care less.
The point on intentions doesn't justify actions. Is wrong. Intentions do justify actions. That is the difference between an accident, an act of self-defence, man slaughter and murder. Whether or not the dorm ops intentions were right or wrong, depends on the evidence and the judge. In my opinion, I felt that their intentions MAY be right. However, we can agree to disagree. There is not enough information for a conclusion anw. 
Your whole argument on me adoring the govt and bla bla bla was out of point. So non-contender.
Your whole appeal to emotion statement also... Yahh I do agree, it rly sucks for them, especially right now. But what does that have to do with the argument here?... I'm not saying that it is not sad / painful for most of them. I'm saying that we don't have the full story, so why are u spreading inaccurate info and your own conclusions...
And also, oof personal attack right there. So... Yea sorry err IDGAF. This says alot more abt your maturity than anyth rly...

@downy_giraffie furthermore, read the following excerpt of the article. "According to MOM, investigations revealed that on Apr 20, the dormitory operator had confined the workers in their room "with consent from the employer of the foreign workers"." note that it was written "consent from the employers", NOT the employees.

@downy_giraffie imagine if it were your son who was locked in there. imagine if you were locked in there. you travelled all the way from your home country to make ends meet for your family and yet all you do is get discriminated. the argument "i don't feel that what the dorm operators did was necessarily wrong" is insensitive. from what i understand you are trying to argue that the employers only do so out of good intentions. however, what they did (action, NOT intention) was inherently wrong and a gross violation of human rights. if this happened to you you'd probably already be finding a lawyer to sue. much like cases of crime, actions do not equate to intention. a "stern warning" is laughable. this issue has been magnified on a global scale. the government whom you adore so much has their reputation at stake. people from all around the world are scrutinizing us. the fact that you'd even justify locking the workers only for a day is appalling. you said it yourself. they do not have the rights to confine the workers! therefore, would they have any more rights to confine them into a warehouse with toilet access? the environment of the confinement does not matter. the problem arises when you unlawfully put people into said confinement.  your entire argument consists of many "maybe"s, but there is no room for hesitation when it comes to a violation of fundamental human rights. you "really don't know." yet, you have never once proven why it is unjust to make such remarks to the agency. you went a full 360° and came back to where you started from. i think it's important to remember where you came from. who you are. you did not slave and leave family behind to support them. you weren't treated as a parasite (although i'm beginning to question that right now.) is that sound enough for you?
@downy_giraffie man straight did a madness

@vimevan fr I’m here cuz this page posts decent memes sometimes. But its extremely cringy when this page thinks its cool af to act anti government. They act as if the government’s always wrong, as if they never did anything to help. And when shit spirals out of control they demand answers from the government. It’s one thing to spit in the hand of someone who’s trying to pick you off the ground. But it’s another, when you take that person’s hand, let him stand you up, then look him in the eye and spit in his face, saying that he was wrong. This page has a presence and the power to influence. Yet they choose to try and turn people against the government when they’ve been trying to help. And honestly, the government has given us advice to stay home yet people still wanna go out, and end up getting infected. And somehow that’s their fault? Somehow we have the right to demand explanations when we’re the ones who didn’t listen despite warnings? I don’t think so man
